data.summary: Refugee claims, PRRA, and H&C applications—confidential, compassionate guidance for protection and permanent residence.

blocks.Title: Refugee / H&C
blocks.Subtitle: Protection, Compassion, and Pathways to Stay
blocks.description: Canada provides refuge and compassion to people facing persecution, danger, or exceptional hardship. We offer sensitive, confidential guidance through refugee claims, PRRA, and humanitarian & compassionate (H&C) applications.

Cards.title: Convention Refugees
Cards.description: Well-founded fear of persecution based on race, religion, nationality, political opinion, or membership in a particular social group.

Cards.title: Persons in Need of Protection
Cards.description: Already in Canada and at risk of torture, threat to life, or cruel and unusual treatment/punishment if returned.

blocks.Heading: Making a Refugee Claim in Canada
Making a Refugee Claim in Canada

Cards.title: How to Claim Refugee Protection Inside Canada
Cards.description: Claim at a Port of Entry (CBSA) or at an inland IRCC office (typically via the online portal).

lists.listItem: Port of Entry: claim on arrival with a CBSA officer
Inland claim: submit online if you’re already in Canada

Cards.title: Refugee Resettlement from Outside Canada
Cards.description: Access protection through Canada’s resettlement programs abroad.

lists.listItem: Usually requires a UNHCR or authorized referral

blocks.Heading: The Refugee Claim Process
blocks.description: Understand the step-by-step pathway after you make a claim.

steps.title: Eligibility Determination
steps.description: IRCC/CBSA screens your claim (prior claims, Safe Third Country, basic docs).

steps.title: Referral to IRB (RPD)
steps.description: Eligible claims are referred to the Refugee Protection Division (independent tribunal).

steps.title: Basis of Claim (BOC) Form
steps.description: Submit detailed personal narrative with evidence and country conditions.

steps.title: Hearing
steps.description: Testify before an RPD member; evidence reviewed; counsel may represent you.

steps.title: Decision
steps.description: If accepted, you’re a protected person and may apply for PR; refusals may have review/appeal options.

Cards.title: Focus on New Evidence
Cards.description: Decision centers on material changes since your last decision.

Cards.title: Core Risk Criteria
Cards.description: Risk of persecution, torture, risk to life, or cruel and unusual treatment.

Cards.title: Document-Based Process
Cards.description: Written submissions (e.g., IMM 5508) with supporting evidence.

Cards.title: IRCC Officer Decision
Cards.description: PRRA is assessed by IRCC (not the IRB’s RPD).

items.listItem: CBSA has notified you that removal proceedings are underway
Your refugee claim was rejected, withdrawn, or deemed abandoned
Judicial review at the Federal Court was unsuccessful
Note: a 12-month bar generally applies after a negative claim/PRRA, subject to limited exceptions
Persecution based on a Convention ground
Risk to life or cruel and unusual treatment/punishment
Lack of a safe internal alternative
Generalized violence or civil war conditions

rows.bestFor: When no regular immigration class applies

blocks.Heading: Pre-Removal Risk Assessment
blocks.description: Removal proceedings underway? You may qualify for a PRRA. We’ll help you understand eligibility and prepare strong submissions.

blocks.Heading: Humanitarian & Compassionate Applications
blocks.description: A discretionary pathway to permanent residence for those who don’t qualify under regular categories—focused on hardship and establishment in Canada.

blocks.Heading: Key Factors Considered in an H&C Application

Cards.title: Establishment in Canada
Cards.description: How well you’ve built your life in Canada.

Cards.title: Best Interests of a Child (BIOC)
Cards.description: Direct impact on children—especially Canadian citizen/PR children.

Cards.title: Hardship if Removed
Cards.description: Undue hardship you’d face in your home country.

Cards.title: Family Ties in Canada
Cards.description: Meaningful connections and supports in Canada.

items.listItem: Discretionary process under s.25(1) IRPA (not a right)
Generally pursued when no other immigration class applies
Personal statement is crucial—clear, truthful narrative
Submit strong evidence (medical, support letters, community involvement, employment, etc.)

blocks.Heading: Need Expert Protection Assistance?
blocks.description: Refugee protection, PRRA, and H&C applications are complex legal processes—don’t navigate them alone.

blocks.Heading: Our Process
blocks.description: A proven 5-step approach to guide you from first consult to decision.

steps.title: Initial Consultation
steps.description: We assess your profile and goals.

steps.title: Strategy Development
steps.description: We design a personalized plan for your situation.

steps.title: Document Preparation
steps.description: We gather and QA all required forms and proof.

steps.title: Application Submission
steps.description: We submit and track your file with IRCC/IRB.

steps.title: Ongoing Support
steps.description: We respond to requests and guide you to decision.

blocks.Heading: Ready to Get Started?
blocks.description: Book a free consultation to discuss the right protection pathway and next steps.
